3c78f105166342eee28de356c8dd","dweb:/ipfs/QmPnC9qNDKwJFd5unwLb9pxjrutoe8MWjm5EXHTxq2kJ4x"]},"src/v0.8/shared/access/ConfirmedOwnerWithProposal.sol":{"keccak256":"0x215529a99534a40e6257ef2282a91ea4a95b66debc3997866406907622efb405","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://ecc56a2cddb1ba6225ca0cffb07fdf6e24bcc4234cc87710c42a59c0a21ae395","dweb:/ipfs/QmSpW4vkPHeRNZ14beMEk2LEtqY5JQTueNJC4sCT8JaSoc"]},"src/v0.8/shared/access/OwnerIsCreator.sol":{"keccak256":"0x895af02d6a3df2930bbb6ec1f2d68118b492ca6e710ba0c34fcb6b574a0906aa","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://c4c69fab5eea1c0448f856a51d7e5736454fe5cc083d36c60bf3ee23bb3d0e8e","dweb:/ipfs/QmP4fYQ9k7xeZms6cwnqnQuuAkRkeE2TWewyvCD8Mrc2DZ"]},"src/v0.8/shared/interfaces/IOwnable.sol":{"keccak256":"0x885de72b7b4e4f1bf8ba817a3f2bcc37fd9022d342c4ce76782151c30122d767","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://17c636625a5d29a140612db496d2cca9fb4b48c673adb0fd7b3957d287e75921","dweb:/ipfs/QmNoBX8TY424bdQWyQC7y3kpKfgxyWxhLw7KEhhEEoBN9q"]},"src/v0.8/shared/interfaces/ITypeAndVersion.sol":{"keccak256":"0xf5827cb463c01d055021684d04f9186391c2d9ac850e0d0819f76140e4fc84ed","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://a19c7bae07330e6d7904a0a21cf0ab0067ef096b66c1653a2e012801a931c5b9","dweb:/ipfs/QmckpvSuLx8UL8zfVzAtN6ZRxyXHUSVqqz2JwYZ2jrK58h"]}},"version":1}

getBlessProgress((address,bytes32)).details: This is a helper method for offchain code so efficiency is not really a concern.

returns.accumulatedWeight: sum of weights of voters, will be zero if voting took place with an older config version
returns.blessVoteAddrs: addresses of voters, will be empty if voting took place with an older config version
returns.blessed: will be accurate regardless of when voting took place

getCurseProgress().details: This is a helper method for offchain code so efficiency is not really a concern.

setConfig(((address,address,address,uint.details: The gas use of this function varies depending on the number of curse votes that are active. When calling this function, be sure to include a gas cushion to account for curse votes that may occur between your transaction being sent and mined.

params.taggedRoots: A tagged root is hashed as `keccak256(abi.encode(taggedRoot.commitStore /* address */, taggedRoot.root /* bytes32 */))`.

acceptOwnership().notice: Allows an ownership transfer to be completed by the recipient.

getConfigDetails().notice: Config version might be incremented for many reasons, including recovery from a curse and a regular config change.

isBlessed((address,bytes32)).notice: Callers MUST NOT cache the return value as a blessed tagged root could become unblessed.

isCursed().notice: When the ARM is "cursed", CCIP pauses until the curse is lifted.

ownerCurse().notice: Enables the owner to immediately have the system enter the cursed state.

ownerResetBlessVotes((address,bytes32)[].notice: Can be called by the owner to remove unintentionally voted or even blessed tagged roots in a recovery scenario. The owner must ensure that there are no in-flight transactions by ARM nodes voting for any of the taggedRoots before calling this function, as such in-flight transactions could lead to the roots becoming re-blessed shortly after the call to this function, contrary to the original intention.

ownerUnvoteToCurse((address,bytes32,bool.notice: Enables the owner to remove curse votes. After the curse votes are removed, this function will check whether the curse is still valid and restore the uncursed state if possible. This function also enables the owner to lift a curse created through ownerCurse.

setConfig(((address,address,address,uint.notice: Will revert in case a curse is active. To avoid accidentally invalidating an in-progress curse vote, it may be advisable to remove voters one-by-one over time, rather than many at once.

transferOwnership(address).notice: Allows an owner to begin transferring ownership to a new address, pending.

unvoteToCurse(address,bytes32).notice: Can be called by a curser to remove unintentional votes to curse. We expect this to be called very rarely, e.g. in case of a bug in the offchain code causing false voteToCurse calls.Should be called from curser's corresponding curseUnvoteAddr.

voteToCurse(bytes32).notice: A vote to curse is appropriate during unhealthy blockchain conditions (eg. finality violations).

documentation.text:
@param taggedRoots A tagged root is hashed as `keccak256(abi.encode(taggedRoot.commitStore
 /* address */, taggedRoot.root /* bytes32 */))`.

@notice Can be called by the owner to remove unintentionally voted or even blessed tagged roots in a recovery
 scenario. The owner must ensure that there are no in-flight transactions by ARM nodes voting for any of the
 taggedRoots before calling this function, as such in-flight transactions could lead to the roots becoming
 re-blessed shortly after the call to this function, contrary to the original intention.

@notice A vote to curse is appropriate during unhealthy blockchain conditions
 (eg. finality violations).
@notice Enables the owner to immediately have the system enter the cursed state.

@notice Config version might be incremented for many reasons, including
 recovery from a curse and a regular config change.

typeDescriptions.typeString: struct ARM.Voter storage ref[] storage ref
struct ARM.Voter storage ref[] storage ref

documentation.text: @dev This is a helper method for offchain code so efficiency is not really a concern.
